title: How to install flang? Or why spack install flang %gcc@6.3.0 doesn't work.
body:
Cannot install flang. Tried many combinations of environments.

### Expected Result

flang

### Actual Result

Build error.

### Steps to reproduce the issue

This particular error message is from our HPC server, so it might not be that easy to write the steps to reproduce. I built all the packages using spack though, with the built-in gcc@5.2.0. I first built gcc@7.2.0, and then re-built everything with it. Then I needed to build gcc@6.3.0 to satisfy the flang's dependencies. Finally I did

```
spack install flang %gcc@6.3.0
```

The error message

```
==> pkgconf is already installed in /cfs/fs2/home/users/aryczkowski/spack/opt/spack/linux-scientific6-x86_64/gcc-6.3.0/pkgconf-1.3.10-id33lp44bpr7yoseb6ge7f4ucxgrks4m
```

First I tried simply `spack install flang`. But this returns a dependency error, because there are conflicts between flex and gcc@7.2.0. 

So I changed to gcc@6.3.0.
